intro: Licaria chinanteca, commonly known as the Chinantec licaria, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a hairy texture. Licaria chinanteca is often found growing in moist, shaded areas within cloud forests.
